Structs/Constants/UnsubscribeGroups.html.name: MaximumNumberOfDisplayGroups
Structs/Constants/UnsubscribeGroups.html.abstract: The maximum number of unsubscribe groups you can specify in the groupsToDisplay property.

Structs/Constants/CustomArguments.html#/.name: MaximumBytes
Structs/Constants/CustomArguments.html#/.abstract: The maximum number of bytes allowed for custom arguments in an email.

Structs/Constants/SubscriptionTracking.h.name: DefaultPlainText
Structs/Constants/SubscriptionTracking.h.abstract: The default verbiage for the plain text unsubscribe footer.

Structs/Constants/SubscriptionTracking.h.name: DefaultHTMLText
Structs/Constants/SubscriptionTracking.h.abstract: The default verbiage for the HTML text unsubscribe footer.

Structs/SGError/Session.html#/s:FOV8Send.name: authenticationMissing
Structs/SGError/Session.html#/s:FOV8Send.abstract: Represents an error where no authentication method was provided.

Structs/SGError/Session.html#/s:FOV8Send.name: authenticationTypeNotAllowed
Structs/SGError/Session.html#/s:FOV8Send.abstract: Represents an error where an unsupported authentication method was used.

Structs/SGError/Request.html#/s:FOV8Send.name: nonConformingRequest
Structs/SGError/Request.html#/s:FOV8Send.abstract: Represents an attempt to use a class that doesn’t conform to Request.

Structs/SGError/Request.html#/s:FOV8Send.name: unableToConstructUrl
Structs/SGError/Request.html#/s:FOV8Send.abstract: Represents an error in constructing the URL for an API call.

Structs/SGError/Request.html#/s:FOV8Send.name: authorizationHeaderError
Structs/SGError/Request.html#/s:FOV8Send.abstract: Represents an error where the Authorization error couldn’t be added to the API call.

Structs/SGError/Request.html#/s:FOV8Send.name: impersonationNotSupported
Structs/SGError/Request.html#/s:FOV8Send.abstract: Thrown when attempting to use the onBehalfOf feature on an API call that doesn’t support it.

Structs/SGError/Mail.html#/s:FOV8SendGri.name: malformedEmailAddress
Structs/SGError/Mail.html#/s:FOV8SendGri.abstract: The error thrown when an email address was expected, but received a String that isn’t RFC 5322 compliant.

Structs/SGError/Mail.html#/s:FOV8SendGri.name: invalidScheduleDate
Structs/SGError/Mail.html#/s:FOV8SendGri.abstract: The error thrown when an email is scheduled further than 72 hours out.

Structs/SGError/Mail.html#/s:FOV8SendGri.name: missingSubscriptionTrackingTag
Structs/SGError/Mail.html#/s:FOV8SendGri.abstract: The error thrown if the subscription tracking setting is configured with text that doesn’t contain a <% %> tag.

Structs/SGError/Mail.html#/s:FOV8SendGri.name: missingRecipients
Structs/SGError/Mail.html#/s:FOV8SendGri.abstract: The error thrown if a personalization doesn’t have at least 1 recipient.

Structs/SGError/Mail.html#/s:FOV8SendGri.name: thresholdOutOfRange
Structs/SGError/Mail.html#/s:FOV8SendGri.abstract: The error thrown when the SpamChecker setting is provided a threshold outside the 1-10 range.

Structs/SGError/Mail.html#/s:FOV8SendGri.name: tooManyUnsubscribeGroups
Structs/SGError/Mail.html#/s:FOV8SendGri.abstract: The error thrown when more than 25 unsubscribe groups are provided in the ASM struct.

Structs/SGError/Mail.html#/s:FOV8SendGri.name: invalidNumberOfPersonalizations
Structs/SGError/Mail.html#/s:FOV8SendGri.abstract: The error thrown if the number of personalizations in an email is less than 1 or more than 100.

Structs/SGError/Mail.html#/s:FOV8SendGri.name: missingContent
Structs/SGError/Mail.html#/s:FOV8SendGri.abstract: The error thrown if an email doesn’t contain any content.

Structs/SGError/Mail.html#/s:FOV8SendGri.name: contentHasEmptyString
Structs/SGError/Mail.html#/s:FOV8SendGri.abstract: The error thrown if a Content instance has an empty string value.

Structs/SGError/Mail.html#/s:FOV8SendGri.name: invalidContentOrder
Structs/SGError/Mail.html#/s:FOV8SendGri.abstract: Thrown if the array of Content instances used in an Email instances is in an incorrect order.

Structs/SGError/Mail.html#/s:FOV8SendGri.name: tooManyRecipients
Structs/SGError/Mail.html#/s:FOV8SendGri.abstract: Thrown when an email contains too many recipients across all the to, cc, and bcc properties of the personalizations.

Structs/SGError/Mail.html#/s:FOV8SendGri.name: missingSubject
Structs/SGError/Mail.html#/s:FOV8SendGri.abstract: Thrown if an email does not contain a subject line.

Structs/SGError/Mail.html#/s:FOV8SendGri.name: headerNotAllowed
Structs/SGError/Mail.html#/s:FOV8SendGri.abstract: Thrown if a reserved header was specified in the custom headers section.

Structs/SGError/Mail.html#/s:FOV8SendGri.name: malformedHeader
Structs/SGError/Mail.html#/s:FOV8SendGri.abstract: Thrown if a header’s name contains spaces.

Structs/SGError/Mail.html#/s:FOV8SendGri.name: tooManyCategories
Structs/SGError/Mail.html#/s:FOV8SendGri.abstract: Thrown if there are more than 10 categories in an email.

Structs/SGError/Mail.html#/s:FOV8SendGri.name: categoryTooLong
Structs/SGError/Mail.html#/s:FOV8SendGri.abstract: Thrown if a category name exceeds 255 characters.

Structs/SGError/Mail.html#/s:FOV8SendGri.name: tooManySubstitutions
Structs/SGError/Mail.html#/s:FOV8SendGri.abstract: Thrown when there are too many substitutions.

Structs/SGError/Mail.html#/s:FOV8SendGri.name: invalidContentType
Structs/SGError/Mail.html#/s:FOV8SendGri.abstract: Thrown if a content type is used with a semicolon or CRLF character.

Structs/SGError/Mail.html#/s:FOV8SendGri.name: duplicateRecipient
Structs/SGError/Mail.html#/s:FOV8SendGri.abstract: Thrown when an email address is listed multiple times in an email.

Structs/SGError/Mail.html#/s:FOV8SendGri.name: tooManyCustomArguments
Structs/SGError/Mail.html#/s:FOV8SendGri.abstract: Thrown when the number of custom arguments exceeds 10,000 bytes.

Structs/SGError/Mail.html#/s:FOV8SendGri.name: invalidContentID
Structs/SGError/Mail.html#/s:FOV8SendGri.abstract: Thrown when an attachment’s content ID contains invalid characters.

Structs/SGError/Mail.html#/s:FOV8SendGri.name: invalidFilename
Structs/SGError/Mail.html#/s:FOV8SendGri.abstract: Thrown when an attachment’s filename contains invalid characters.

Structs/SGError/Mail.html.name: Mail
Structs/SGError/Mail.html.abstract: The Mail enum contains all the errors thrown for the mail send API.

Structs/SGError/Request.html.name: Request
Structs/SGError/Request.html.abstract: The Request enum contains all the errors thrown when attempting to build an HTTP request.

Structs/SGError/Session.html.name: Session
Structs/SGError/Session.html.abstract: The Session enum contains all the errors thrown when attempting to build an HTTP request.

Structs/SGError.html.name: SGError
Structs/SGError.html.abstract: The SGError struct contains all the errors that the SendGrid-Swift library can throw.

Structs/Constants.html.name: Constants
Structs/Constants.html.abstract: A struct containing a set of constants used throughout the library.

Protocols/Validatable.html#/s:FP8SendGri.name: validate()
Protocols/Validatable.html#/s:FP8SendGri.abstract: This method is implemented by all conforming classes to validate their own values. If everything is valid, the method does not need to return or do anything. If one or more values are invalid, an error should be thrown.

Protocols/TrackingSetting.html#/s:vP8Sen.name: enable
Protocols/TrackingSetting.html#/s:vP8Sen.abstract: A bool indicating if the setting should be toggle on or off.

Protocols/Scheduling.html#/s:vP8SendGrid.name: sendAt
Protocols/Scheduling.html#/s:vP8SendGrid.abstract: An optional time to send the email at. The date cannot be further than 72 hours in the future.

Protocols/Request.html#/s:vP8SendGrid7Re.name: acceptType
Protocols/Request.html#/s:vP8SendGrid7Re.abstract: The Content-Type of what you’re expecting back.

Protocols/Request.html#/s:vP8SendGrid7Re.name: parameters
Protocols/Request.html#/s:vP8SendGrid7Re.abstract: The parameters that should be sent with the API request.

Protocols/Request.html#/s:FP8SendGrid7Re.name: request(for:onBehalfOf:)
Protocols/Request.html#/s:FP8SendGrid7Re.abstract: Returns a configured URLRequest with the proper authenticaiton information.

Protocols/Request.html#/s:vE8SendGridPS_.name: description
Protocols/Request.html#/s:vE8SendGridPS_.abstract: The default description uses APIBlueprint to generate an API Blueprint output of the request.

Protocols/MailSetting.html#/s:vP8SendGri.name: enable
Protocols/MailSetting.html#/s:vP8SendGri.abstract: A bool indicating if the setting should be toggle on or off.

Protocols/HTTPMessage.html#/s:vP8SendGri.name: method
Protocols/HTTPMessage.html#/s:vP8SendGri.abstract: The HTTP method that should be used for the API call.

Protocols/HeaderValidator.html#/s:FP8Sen.name: validate(headers:)
Protocols/HeaderValidator.html#/s:FP8Sen.abstract: Validates a set of headers to ensure they are not using any reserved headers. If there is a problem, an error is thrown. If everything is fine, then this method returns nothing.

Protocols/DictionaryConvertible.html.name: DictionaryConvertible
Protocols/DictionaryConvertible.html.abstract: The DictionaryConvertible protocol defines the properties a class or struct needs to implement in order to be represented as a dictionary. This is used to help generate the JSON payload that eventually gets sent to the SendGrid API.

Protocols/HeaderValidator.html.name: HeaderValidator
Protocols/HeaderValidator.html.abstract: The HeaderValidator protocol provides a method for ensuring custom headers are valid.

Protocols/HTTPMessage.html.name: HTTPMessage
Protocols/HTTPMessage.html.abstract: The HTTPMessage protocol defines the properties and methods required to be used as an HTTP request or response.

Protocols/JSONConvertible.html.name: JSONConvertible
Protocols/JSONConvertible.html.abstract: The JSONConvertible protocol defines the properties needed for a class to provide a JSON representation of itself. This is used to generate the JSON sent to the SendGrid API.

Protocols/MailSetting.html.name: MailSetting
Protocols/MailSetting.html.abstract: The MailSetting protocol represents the properties needed for a class to represent a mail setting.

Protocols/Request.html.name: Request
Protocols/Request.html.abstract: The Request protocol lays out the required properties and methods a class must implement in order to be used by Session to make an HTTP request.

Protocols/Scheduling.html.name: Scheduling
Protocols/Scheduling.html.abstract: The Scheduling protocol contains the properties and methods needed for a class to support scheduled sends.

Protocols/TrackingSetting.html.name: TrackingSetting
Protocols/TrackingSetting.html.abstract: The TrackingSetting protocol represents the properties needed for a class to represent a tracking setting.

Protocols/Validatable.html.name: Validatable
Protocols/Validatable.html.abstract: The Validatable protocol defines the functions that a class or struct needs to implement in order to be used as an email property and validate their own values.

Enums/HTTPMethod.html#/s:vO8SendGrid10HT.name: description
Enums/HTTPMethod.html#/s:vO8SendGrid10HT.abstract: The String representation of the HTTP method.

Enums/HTTPMethod.html#/s:vO8SendGrid10HT.name: hasBody
Enums/HTTPMethod.html#/s:vO8SendGrid10HT.abstract: A bool indicating if the HTTP method contains an HTTP body in its request.

Enums/ContentType.html#/s:FO8SendGrid11C.name: plainText
Enums/ContentType.html#/s:FO8SendGrid11C.abstract: The text/plain content type, used for the plain text portion of an email.

Enums/ContentType.html#/s:FO8SendGrid11C.name: htmlText
Enums/ContentType.html#/s:FO8SendGrid11C.abstract: The text/html content type, used for the HTML portion of an email.

Enums/ContentType.html#/s:FO8SendGrid11C.name: csv
Enums/ContentType.html#/s:FO8SendGrid11C.abstract: The application/csv content type, used for CSV attachments.

Enums/ContentType.html#/s:FO8SendGrid11C.name: pdf
Enums/ContentType.html#/s:FO8SendGrid11C.abstract: The application/pdf content type, used for PDF attachments.

Enums/ContentType.html#/s:FO8SendGrid11C.name: zip
Enums/ContentType.html#/s:FO8SendGrid11C.abstract: The application/zip content type, used for Zip file attachments.

Enums/ContentType.html#/s:FO8SendGrid11C.name: png
Enums/ContentType.html#/s:FO8SendGrid11C.abstract: The image/png content type, used for PNG images.

Enums/ContentType.html#/s:FO8SendGrid11C.name: jpeg
Enums/ContentType.html#/s:FO8SendGrid11C.abstract: The image/jpeg content type, used for JPEG images.

Enums/ContentType.html#/s:FO8SendGrid11C.name: other
Enums/ContentType.html#/s:FO8SendGrid11C.abstract: A case used for any content type that isn’t explicity stated in the enum.

Enums/ContentType.html#/s:vO8SendGrid11C.name: description
Enums/ContentType.html#/s:vO8SendGrid11C.abstract: The string value of the content type.

Enums/ContentType.html#/s:FO8SendGrid11C.name: init(description:)
Enums/ContentType.html#/s:FO8SendGrid11C.abstract: Initializes the enum with a String representing the Content-Type.

Enums/ContentDisposition.html#/s:FO8Send.name: inline
Enums/ContentDisposition.html#/s:FO8Send.abstract: The inline disposition, which shows the attachment inline with text.

Enums/ContentDisposition.html#/s:FO8Send.name: attachment
Enums/ContentDisposition.html#/s:FO8Send.abstract: The attachment disposition, which shows the attachment below the text.

Enums/Authentication.html#/s:FO8SendGrid.name: credential
Enums/Authentication.html#/s:FO8SendGrid.abstract: Used to authenticate with a username and password.

Enums/Authentication.html#/s:FO8SendGrid.name: apiKey
Enums/Authentication.html#/s:FO8SendGrid.abstract: Used to authenticate with a SendGrid API Key.

Enums/Authentication.html#/s:FO8SendGrid.name: init(info:)
Enums/Authentication.html#/s:FO8SendGrid.abstract: Initializes with a dictionary and returns the most appropriate authentication type.

Enums/Authentication.html#/s:vO8SendGrid.name: user
Enums/Authentication.html#/s:vO8SendGrid.abstract: Retrieves the user value for the authentication type (applies only to .Credential).

Enums/Authentication.html#/s:vO8SendGrid.name: key
Enums/Authentication.html#/s:vO8SendGrid.abstract: Retrieves the key value for that authentication type. If the type is a .Credentials, this will be the password. Otherwise it will be the API key value.

Enums/Authentication.html#/s:vO8SendGrid.name: authorizationHeader
Enums/Authentication.html#/s:vO8SendGrid.abstract: Returns that Authorization header value for the authentication type. This can be used on any web API V3 call.

Enums/Authentication.html.name: Authentication
Enums/Authentication.html.abstract: The Authentication enum is used to represent the various ways you can authenticate with the SendGrid API. Aside from representing the different methods, they also store the values of the desired authentication method.

Enums/ContentDisposition.html.name: ContentDisposition
Enums/ContentDisposition.html.abstract: The ContentDisposition represents the various content-dispositions an attachment can have.

Enums/ContentType.html.name: ContentType
Enums/ContentType.html.abstract: The ContentType enum represents the common types of Content Types used when sending through the SendGrid API.

Enums/HTTPMethod.html.name: HTTPMethod
Enums/HTTPMethod.html.abstract: The HTTPMethod enum represents the various verbs used in an HTTP request.

Classes/SubscriptionTracking.html#/s:vC8.name: text
Classes/SubscriptionTracking.html#/s:vC8.abstract: Text to be appended to the email, with the subscription tracking link. You may control where the link is by using the tag <% %>. For example:

Classes/SubscriptionTracking.html#/s:vC8.name: html
Classes/SubscriptionTracking.html#/s:vC8.abstract: HTML to be appended to the email, with the subscription tracking link. You may control where the link is by using the tag <% %>. For example:

Classes/SubscriptionTracking.html#/s:vC8.name: substitutionTag
Classes/SubscriptionTracking.html#/s:vC8.abstract: A tag that will be replaced with the unsubscribe URL. For example: [unsubscribe_url]. If this parameter is used, it will override both the text and html parameters. The URL of the link will be placed at the substitution tag’s location, with no additional formatting.

Classes/SubscriptionTracking.html#/s:FC8.name: init(enable:plainText:HTML:substitutionTag:)
Classes/SubscriptionTracking.html#/s:FC8.abstract: Initializes the setting with verbiage for the plain text and HTML versions of an email. Both of these parameter must contain a <% %> tag which indicates where the unsubscribe URL should be placed, otherwise an error is thrown.

Classes/SubscriptionTracking.html#/s:FC8.name: validate()
Classes/SubscriptionTracking.html#/s:FC8.abstract: Validates that the plain text and HTML text contain the proper tag.

Classes/OpenTracking.html#/s:vC8SendGrid.name: substitutionTag
Classes/OpenTracking.html#/s:vC8SendGrid.abstract: An optional tag to specify where to place the open tracking pixel.

Classes/GoogleAnalytics.html#/s:vC8SendG.name: source
Classes/GoogleAnalytics.html#/s:vC8SendG.abstract: Name of the referrer source. (e.g. Google, SomeDomain.com, or Marketing Email)

Classes/GoogleAnalytics.html#/s:vC8SendG.name: content
Classes/GoogleAnalytics.html#/s:vC8SendG.abstract: Used to differentiate your campaign from advertisements.

Classes/ClickTracking.html#/s:vC8SendGri.name: enableText
Classes/ClickTracking.html#/s:vC8SendGri.abstract: A boolean indicating if click tracking should also be applied to links inside a plain text email.

Classes/SpamChecker.html#/s:vC8SendGrid1.name: threshold
Classes/SpamChecker.html#/s:vC8SendGrid1.abstract: The threshold used to determine if your content qualifies as spam on a scale from 1 to 10, with 10 being most strict, or most likely to be considered as spam.

Classes/SpamChecker.html#/s:vC8SendGrid1.name: postURL
Classes/SpamChecker.html#/s:vC8SendGrid1.abstract: A webhook URL that you would like a copy of your email along with the spam report to be POSTed to.

Classes/SpamChecker.html#/s:FC8SendGrid1.name: init(enable:threshold:url:)
Classes/SpamChecker.html#/s:FC8SendGrid1.abstract: Initializes the setting with a threshold and optional URL to POST spam reports to. If threshold is either below 1 or above 10, an error is thrown.

Classes/SpamChecker.html#/s:FC8SendGrid1.name: validate()
Classes/SpamChecker.html#/s:FC8SendGrid1.abstract: Validates that the threshold is within the correct range.

Classes/Footer.html#/s:vC8SendGrid6Foote.name: text
Classes/Footer.html#/s:vC8SendGrid6Foote.abstract: The plain text content of your footer.

Classes/Footer.html#/s:FC8SendGrid6Foote.name: init(enable:text:html:)
Classes/Footer.html#/s:FC8SendGrid6Foote.abstract: Initializes the setting with plain text and HTML to use in the footer.

Classes/BCCSetting.html#/s:vC8SendGrid10.name: email
Classes/BCCSetting.html#/s:vC8SendGrid10.abstract: The email address that you would like to receive the BCC.

Classes/BCCSetting.html#/s:FC8SendGrid10.name: init(enable:email:)
Classes/BCCSetting.html#/s:FC8SendGrid10.abstract: Initializes the setting with an email to use as the BCC address. If the address is malformed, an error is thrown.

Classes/BCCSetting.html#/s:FC8SendGrid10.name: validate()
Classes/BCCSetting.html#/s:FC8SendGrid10.abstract: Validates that the BCC email is a valid email address.

Classes/Setting.html#/s:vC8SendGrid7Sett.name: enable
Classes/Setting.html#/s:vC8SendGrid7Sett.abstract: A bool indicating if the setting should be on or off.

Classes/Setting.html#/s:FC8SendGrid7Sett.name: init(enable:)
Classes/Setting.html#/s:FC8SendGrid7Sett.abstract: Initializes the setting with a boolean indicating if the setting should be on or off.

Classes/RateLimit.html#/s:vC8SendGrid9Ra.name: limit
Classes/RateLimit.html#/s:vC8SendGrid9Ra.abstract: The number of calls allowed for this resource during the refresh period.

Classes/RateLimit.html#/s:vC8SendGrid9Ra.name: remaining
Classes/RateLimit.html#/s:vC8SendGrid9Ra.abstract: The number of calls remaining for this resource during the current refresh period.

Classes/RateLimit.html#/s:vC8SendGrid9Ra.name: resetDate
Classes/RateLimit.html#/s:vC8SendGrid9Ra.abstract: The date and time at which the refresh period will reset.

Classes/Content.html#/s:FC8SendGrid7Cont.name: init(contentType:value:)
Classes/Content.html#/s:FC8SendGrid7Cont.abstract: Initializes the content with a content type and value.

Classes/Content.html#/s:ZFC8SendGrid7Con.name: plainTextContent(_:)
Classes/Content.html#/s:ZFC8SendGrid7Con.abstract: Creates a new Content instance used to represent a plain text body.

Classes/Content.html#/s:ZFC8SendGrid7Con.name: htmlContent(_:)
Classes/Content.html#/s:ZFC8SendGrid7Con.abstract: Creates a new Content instance used to represent an HTML body.

Classes/Content.html#/s:ZFC8SendGrid7Con.name: emailContent(plain:html:)
Classes/Content.html#/s:ZFC8SendGrid7Con.abstract: Return an array containing a plain text and html body.

Classes/ASM.html#/s:vC8SendGrid3ASM2idSi.name: id
Classes/ASM.html#/s:vC8SendGrid3ASM2idSi.abstract: The ID of the unsubscribe group to use.

Classes/ASM.html#/s:vC8SendGrid3ASM15gro.name: groupsToDisplay
Classes/ASM.html#/s:vC8SendGrid3ASM15gro.abstract: A list of IDs that should be shown on the Manage Subscription page for this email.

Classes/ASM.html#/s:FC8SendGrid3ASMcFT7g.name: init(groupID:groupsToDisplay:)
Classes/ASM.html#/s:FC8SendGrid3ASMcFT7g.abstract: Initializes the struct with a group ID and a list of group IDs to display on the manage subscription page for the email.

Classes/ASM.html#/s:FC8SendGrid3ASM8vali.name: validate()
Classes/ASM.html#/s:FC8SendGrid3ASM8vali.abstract: Validates that there are no more than 25 groups to display.

Classes/APIBlueprint.html#/s:vC8SendGrid.name: location
Classes/APIBlueprint.html#/s:vC8SendGrid.abstract: The URL of the HTTP request or response.

Classes/APIBlueprint.html#/s:vC8SendGrid.name: contentType
Classes/APIBlueprint.html#/s:vC8SendGrid.abstract: The content type of the HTTP request or response.

Classes/APIBlueprint.html#/s:vC8SendGrid.name: type
Classes/APIBlueprint.html#/s:vC8SendGrid.abstract: Indicates if this is a Request or a Response.

Classes/APIBlueprint.html#/s:vC8SendGrid.name: headers
Classes/APIBlueprint.html#/s:vC8SendGrid.abstract: Any headers in the HTTP request or response.

Classes/APIBlueprint.html#/s:vC8SendGrid.name: body
Classes/APIBlueprint.html#/s:vC8SendGrid.abstract: The body of the HTTP request or response.

Classes/APIBlueprint.html#/s:FC8SendGrid.name: init(method:location:contentType:type:headers:body:statusCode:)
Classes/APIBlueprint.html#/s:FC8SendGrid.abstract: Initializes the struct with all the properties.

Classes/APIBlueprint.html#/s:FC8SendGrid.name: init(method:location:contentType:type:headers:parameters:statusCode:)
Classes/APIBlueprint.html#/s:FC8SendGrid.abstract: Initializes the struct with all the properties.

Classes/APIBlueprint.html#/s:vC8SendGrid.name: description
Classes/APIBlueprint.html#/s:vC8SendGrid.abstract: The entire blueprint represented as a String.

Classes/APIBlueprint/MessageType.html.name: MessageType
Classes/APIBlueprint/MessageType.html.abstract: The MessageType enum represents the two types of HTTP messages (requests and responses).

Classes/Address.html#/s:vC8SendGrid7Addr.name: name
Classes/Address.html#/s:vC8SendGrid7Addr.abstract: An optional name to display instead of the email address.

Classes/Address.html#/s:vC8SendGrid7Addr.name: dictionaryValue
Classes/Address.html#/s:vC8SendGrid7Addr.abstract: The dictionary representation of the Address, used to generate the JSON payload sent to the SendGrid API.

Classes/Address.html#/s:FC8SendGrid7Addr.name: init(email:name:)
Classes/Address.html#/s:FC8SendGrid7Addr.abstract: Initializes the address with an email address and an optional display name.

Classes/Address.html#/s:FC8SendGrid7Addr.name: init(_:)
Classes/Address.html#/s:FC8SendGrid7Addr.abstract: Initializes the address with a String representing the email address.

Classes/Address.html#/s:FC8SendGrid7Addr.name: validate()
Classes/Address.html#/s:FC8SendGrid7Addr.abstract: Validates that the email address is an RFC compliant email address.

Classes/Personalization.html#/s:vC8SendG.name: to
Classes/Personalization.html#/s:vC8SendG.abstract: An array of recipients to send the email to.

Classes/Personalization.html#/s:vC8SendG.name: cc
Classes/Personalization.html#/s:vC8SendG.abstract: An array of recipients to add as a CC on the email.

Classes/Personalization.html#/s:vC8SendG.name: bcc
Classes/Personalization.html#/s:vC8SendG.abstract: An array of recipients to add as a BCC on the email.

Classes/Personalization.html#/s:vC8SendG.name: headers
Classes/Personalization.html#/s:vC8SendG.abstract: An optional set of headers to add to the email in this personalization. Each key in the dictionary should represent the name of the header, and the values of the dictionary should be equal to the values of the headers.

Classes/Personalization.html#/s:vC8SendG.name: substitutions
Classes/Personalization.html#/s:vC8SendG.abstract: An optional set of substitutions to replace in this personalization. The keys in the dictionary should represent the substitution tags that should be replaced, and the values should be the replacement values.

Classes/Personalization.html#/s:vC8SendG.name: customArguments
Classes/Personalization.html#/s:vC8SendG.abstract: A set of custom arguments to add to the email. The keys of the dictionary should be the names of the custom arguments, while the values should represent the value of each custom argument.

Classes/Personalization.html#/s:vC8SendG.name: sendAt
Classes/Personalization.html#/s:vC8SendG.abstract: An optional time to send the email at.

Classes/Personalization.html#/s:FC8SendG.name: init(to:cc:bcc:subject:headers:substitutions:customArguments:)
Classes/Personalization.html#/s:FC8SendG.abstract: Initializes the email with all the available properties.

Classes/Personalization.html#/s:FC8SendG.name: init(recipients:)
Classes/Personalization.html#/s:FC8SendG.abstract: Initializes the personalization with a set of email addresses.

Classes/Personalization.html#/s:FC8SendG.name: validate()
Classes/Personalization.html#/s:FC8SendG.abstract: Validates that the personalization has recipients and that they are proper email addresses as well as making sure the sendAt date is valid.

Classes/Email.html#/s:vC8SendGrid5Email1.name: personalizations
Classes/Email.html#/s:vC8SendGrid5Email1.abstract: An array of personalization instances representing the various recipients of the email.

Classes/Email.html#/s:vC8SendGrid5Email7.name: subject
Classes/Email.html#/s:vC8SendGrid5Email7.abstract: The subject of the email. If the personalizations in the email contain subjects, those will override this subject.

Classes/Email.html#/s:vC8SendGrid5Email7.name: replyTo
Classes/Email.html#/s:vC8SendGrid5Email7.abstract: The reply to address on the email.

Classes/Email.html#/s:vC8SendGrid5Email1.name: templateID
Classes/Email.html#/s:vC8SendGrid5Email1.abstract: The ID of a template from the Template Engine to use with the email.

Classes/Email.html#/s:vC8SendGrid5Email7.name: headers
Classes/Email.html#/s:vC8SendGrid5Email7.abstract: Additional headers that should be added to the email.

Classes/Email.html#/s:vC8SendGrid5Email8.name: sections
Classes/Email.html#/s:vC8SendGrid5Email8.abstract: A dictionary of key/value pairs that define large blocks of content that can be inserted into your emails using substitution tags. An example of this might look like the following:

Classes/Email.html#/s:vC8SendGrid5Email1.name: customArguments
Classes/Email.html#/s:vC8SendGrid5Email1.abstract: A set of custom arguments to add to the email. The keys of the dictionary should be the names of the custom arguments, while the values should represent the value of each custom argument. If personalizations in the email also contain custom arguments, they will be merged with these custom arguments, taking a preference to the personalization’s custom arguments in the case of a conflict.

Classes/Email.html#/s:vC8SendGrid5Email3.name: asm
Classes/Email.html#/s:vC8SendGrid5Email3.abstract: An ASM instance representing the unsubscribe group settings to apply to the email.

Classes/Email.html#/s:vC8SendGrid5Email6.name: sendAt
Classes/Email.html#/s:vC8SendGrid5Email6.abstract: An optional time to send the email at.

Classes/Email.html#/s:vC8SendGrid5Email7.name: batchID
Classes/Email.html#/s:vC8SendGrid5Email7.abstract: This ID represents a batch of emails (AKA multiple sends of the same email) to be associated to each other for scheduling. Including a batch_id in your request allows you to include this email in that batch, and also enables you to cancel or pause the delivery of that entire batch. For more information, please read about Cancel Scheduled Sends.

Classes/Email.html#/s:vC8SendGrid5Email1.name: ipPoolName
Classes/Email.html#/s:vC8SendGrid5Email1.abstract: The IP Pool that you would like to send this email from. See the docs page for more information about creating IP Pools.

Classes/Email.html#/s:vC8SendGrid5Email1.name: mailSettings
Classes/Email.html#/s:vC8SendGrid5Email1.abstract: An optional array of mail settings to configure the email with.

Classes/Email.html#/s:vC8SendGrid5Email1.name: trackingSettings
Classes/Email.html#/s:vC8SendGrid5Email1.abstract: An optional array of tracking settings to configure the email with.

Classes/Email.html#/s:vC8SendGrid5Email1.name: contentType
Classes/Email.html#/s:vC8SendGrid5Email1.abstract: The content type for the API request.

Classes/Email.html#/s:vC8SendGrid5Email6.name: method
Classes/Email.html#/s:vC8SendGrid5Email6.abstract: The HTTP method used for the API request.

Classes/Email.html#/s:vC8SendGrid5Email1.name: parameters
Classes/Email.html#/s:vC8SendGrid5Email1.abstract: The parameters sent with the API request.

Classes/Email.html#/s:FC8SendGrid5Emailc.name: init(personalizations:from:content:subject:)
Classes/Email.html#/s:FC8SendGrid5Emailc.abstract: Initializes the email with an array of personalizations, a subject, and content.

Classes/Email.html#/s:FC8SendGrid5Email8.name: validate()
Classes/Email.html#/s:FC8SendGrid5Email8.abstract: Validates the email and throws any errors if necessary.

Classes/Email.html#/s:FC8SendGrid5Email7.name: request(for:onBehalfOf:)
Classes/Email.html#/s:FC8SendGrid5Email7.abstract: Returns a configured NSMutableURLRequest with the proper authenticaiton information.

Classes/Attachment.html#/s:vC8SendGrid10.name: content
Classes/Attachment.html#/s:vC8SendGrid10.abstract: The content, or data, of the attachment.

Classes/Attachment.html#/s:vC8SendGrid10.name: type
Classes/Attachment.html#/s:vC8SendGrid10.abstract: The content (or MIME) type of the attachment.

Classes/Attachment.html#/s:vC8SendGrid10.name: disposition
Classes/Attachment.html#/s:vC8SendGrid10.abstract: The content-disposition of the attachment specifying how you would like the attachment to be displayed. For example, inline results in the attached file being displayed automatically within the message while attachment results in the attached file requiring some action to be taken before it is displayed (e.g. opening or downloading the file).

Classes/Attachment.html#/s:vC8SendGrid10.name: contentID
Classes/Attachment.html#/s:vC8SendGrid10.abstract: A unique id that you specify for the attachment. This is used when the disposition is set to inline and the attachment is an image, allowing the file to be displayed within the body of your email. Ex: <img src="cid:ii_139db99fdb5c3704"></img>

Classes/Attachment.html#/s:FC8SendGrid10.name: validate()
Classes/Attachment.html#/s:FC8SendGrid10.abstract: Validates that the content type of the attachment is correct.

Classes/Session.html#/s:vC8SendGrid7Sess.name: authentication
Classes/Session.html#/s:vC8SendGrid7Sess.abstract: This property holds the authentication information (credentials, or API Key) for the API requests via the Authentication enum.

Classes/Session.html#/s:ZvC8SendGrid7Ses.name: shared
Classes/Session.html#/s:ZvC8SendGrid7Ses.abstract: A shared singleton instance of SGSession. Using the shared instance allows you to configure it once with the desired authentication method, and then continually reuse it without the need for re-configuration.

Classes/Session.html#/s:FC8SendGrid7Sess.name: init(auth:)
Classes/Session.html#/s:FC8SendGrid7Sess.abstract: Initiates an instance of SGSession with the given authentication method.

Classes/Session.html#/s:FC8SendGrid7Sess.name: send(request:onBehalfOf:completionHandler:)
Classes/Session.html#/s:FC8SendGrid7Sess.abstract: Makes the HTTP request with the given Request object.

Classes/Session.html#/s:FC8SendGrid7Sess.name: send(request:completionHandler:)
Classes/Session.html#/s:FC8SendGrid7Sess.abstract: Makes the HTTP request with the given Request object.

Classes/Response.html#/s:vC8SendGrid8Res.name: request
Classes/Response.html#/s:vC8SendGrid8Res.abstract: The original Request that this response is associated with.

Classes/Response.html#/s:vC8SendGrid8Res.name: data
Classes/Response.html#/s:vC8SendGrid8Res.abstract: The raw data from the HTTP response.

Classes/Response.html#/s:vC8SendGrid8Res.name: rateLimit
Classes/Response.html#/s:vC8SendGrid8Res.abstract: Information about the rate limiting on the request that was just made (if present).

Classes/Response.html#/s:vC8SendGrid8Res.name: method
Classes/Response.html#/s:vC8SendGrid8Res.abstract: The HTTP Method used on the original request.

Classes/Response.html#/s:vC8SendGrid8Res.name: statusCode
Classes/Response.html#/s:vC8SendGrid8Res.abstract: The HTTP status code abstracted from the urlResponse.

Classes/Response.html#/s:vC8SendGrid8Res.name: contentType
Classes/Response.html#/s:vC8SendGrid8Res.abstract: The content type of the response abstracted from the urlResponse.

Classes/Response.html#/s:vC8SendGrid8Res.name: stringValue
Classes/Response.html#/s:vC8SendGrid8Res.abstract: Returns the string representation of the data property, if able.

Classes/Response.html#/s:vC8SendGrid8Res.name: jsonValue
Classes/Response.html#/s:vC8SendGrid8Res.abstract: Returns the JSON representation of the data property, if able.

Classes/Response.html#/s:vC8SendGrid8Res.name: description
Classes/Response.html#/s:vC8SendGrid8Res.abstract: Returns an API Blueprint of the response as a String.

Classes/Response.html#/s:FC8SendGrid8Res.name: init(request:data:urlResponse:)
Classes/Response.html#/s:FC8SendGrid8Res.abstract: Initializes the class with all the necessary properties.

Classes/APIV3.html#/s:vC8SendGrid5APIV31.name: messageHeaders
Classes/APIV3.html#/s:vC8SendGrid5APIV31.abstract: Additional headers to add to the HTTP request.

Classes/APIV3.html#/s:FC8SendGrid5APIV37.name: request(for:onBehalfOf:)
Classes/APIV3.html#/s:FC8SendGrid5APIV37.abstract: Returns a configured NSMutableURLRequest with the proper authenticaiton information.

Classes/APIV3.html.name: APIV3
Classes/APIV3.html.abstract: The APIV3 class is inherited by other classes to provide default implementations of the Request protocol.

Classes/Response.html.name: Response
Classes/Response.html.abstract: The Response struct organizes and parses the HTTP responses returned from API calls.

Classes/Session.html.name: Session
Classes/Session.html.abstract: The Session class is used to faciliate the HTTP request to the SendGrid API endpoints. When starting out, you’ll want to configure Session with your authentication information, whether that be credentials or an API Key. A class conforming to the Resource protocol is then used to provide information about the desired API call.

Classes/Attachment.html.name: Attachment
Classes/Attachment.html.abstract: The Attachment class represents a file to attach to an email.

Classes/Email.html.name: Email
Classes/Email.html.abstract: The Email class represents an email message to send through the SendGrid API.

Classes/Personalization.html.name: Personalization
Classes/Personalization.html.abstract: The Personalization struct is used by the Email class to add personalization settings to an email. The only required property is the to property, and each email must have at least one personalization.

Classes/Address.html.name: Address
Classes/Address.html.abstract: The Address class represents an email address and contains the email address along with an optional display name.

Classes/APIBlueprint.html.name: APIBlueprint
Classes/APIBlueprint.html.abstract: The APIBlueprint class takes information about an HTTPMessage, and formats it into an API Blueprint.

Classes/ASM.html.name: ASM
Classes/ASM.html.abstract: The ASM class is used to specify an unsubscribe group to associate the email with.

Classes/Content.html.name: Content
Classes/Content.html.abstract: The Content class represents a MIME part of the email message (i.e. the plain text and HTML parts of an email).

Classes/RateLimit.html.name: RateLimit
Classes/RateLimit.html.abstract: The RateLimit struct abstracts any rate-limit information returned from an NSURLResponse.

Classes/Setting.html.name: Setting
Classes/Setting.html.abstract: The Setting class is a base class that is inherited by both the mail setting and tracking setting options. It should not be used directly.

Classes/BCCSetting.html.name: BCCSetting
Classes/BCCSetting.html.abstract: This allows you to have a blind carbon copy automatically sent to the specified email address for every email that is sent.

Classes/BypassListManagement.html.name: BypassListManagement
Classes/BypassListManagement.html.abstract: The BypassListManagement class allows you to bypass all unsubscribe groups and suppressions to ensure that the email is delivered to every single recipient. This should only be used in emergencies when it is absolutely necessary that every recipient receives your email. Ex: outage emails, or forgot password emails.

Classes/Footer.html.name: Footer
Classes/Footer.html.abstract: The Footer mail setting allows you to specify a footer that will be appended to the bottom of every email.

Classes/SandboxMode.html.name: SandboxMode
Classes/SandboxMode.html.abstract: This allows you to send a test email to ensure that your request body is valid and formatted correctly. For more information, please see the SendGrid docs.

Classes/SpamChecker.html.name: SpamChecker
Classes/SpamChecker.html.abstract: The SpamChecker mail setting allows you to test the content of your email for spam.

Classes/ClickTracking.html.name: ClickTracking
Classes/ClickTracking.html.abstract: The ClickTracking class is used to adjust the click tracking setting.

Classes/GoogleAnalytics.html.name: GoogleAnalytics
Classes/GoogleAnalytics.html.abstract: The GoogleAnalytics class is used to toggle the Google Analytics setting, which adds GA parameters to links in the email.

Classes/OpenTracking.html.name: OpenTracking
Classes/OpenTracking.html.abstract: The OpenTracking class is used to toggle the open tracking setting for an email.

Classes/SubscriptionTracking.html.name: SubscriptionTracking
Classes/SubscriptionTracking.html.abstract: The SubscriptionTracking class is used to modify the subscription tracking setting on an email.

Classes.html.name: Classes
Classes.html.abstract: The following classes are available globally.

Enums.html.name: Enums
Enums.html.abstract: The following enums are available globally.

Protocols.html.name: Protocols
Protocols.html.abstract: The following protocols are available globally.

Structs.html.name: Structs
Structs.html.abstract: The following structs are available globally.
